content.description:
This is the pointy buldge that is below and left of the

Peddy's  Crack

. Start at the point and do what ever you can to mantle up. Finish up on

Peddy's  Crack

or go left for a different crack that might be easier.
Climb the face and flake left of Blockhead.
content.location: Located on the left (western) face of "The Shoulder Boulder" A.K.A. "The Blockheads."

content.description: Work your way up the crack on the right. I like to pull left and get a nice breath on the ledge before commiting to the top, but it's not necessary.
content.location: On the right side of the prow of the Shoulder Boulder. It will most likely be the first thing you see coming from the Energy Crag.

content.description: Start under the south face roof, and climb up and over the roof continuing up the steep thin wall to the finish. I am not for sure that this line ever went, but I will find out soon. I think it was in the V8 or harder, ballpark. It's a sweet line and a little on the highball side.
content.location: It is uphill (west) from the Energy Wall. At the top of the small ridge, you will run into "The Blockheads." The line climbs through the center roof and face above on the south face.

content.description:
Climb the blunt south west corner/face via small but positive crimps.  This is an aggressive line and may be harder than I remember?  Either way it's a classic at the "Blockheads/A.K.A. The Shoulder Boulder."

A must do!!
content.location: Up hill (west) from the Energy Wall.  At the top of the small ridge you will run into "The Blockheads."  The line is on the blunt south west corner/face.
